column4: does anyone know why when i try to encode mp3's with audacity the output is a silent file of 0kbs?
Audacity asks for libmp3lame.so - has Audacity asked you where to find the library?
yes, have located that
It's a pain, but try saving from Audacity to .wav, and then using lame to encode it to mp3.
is this a known issue then with audacity? also have i installed the right packages by installing lame-dev and lame0?
not to my knowledge. I use Audacity pretty frequently, and have no trouble after telling it where to find lib for lame.
I could md5sum my libmp3lame.so for you, to see if it matches yours if you like...
it appears to make a noise when i play the encoded mp3 but not the sound it should make!
sure. please do.
20ac32cd0185cca0c104caefb6e0fb3e  /usr/local/lib/libmp3lame.so
is that version 3.96.1?
do u think a restart of my machine would help?
same version as mine
Gnome has fixed itself by a restart of the machine now and then. But I don't see why a library would act the same. Worth a shot, I guess.
k. thanks anyway
just to check... lame-dev and lame0 r the only packages in need right?
I'm not 100% on that one... but having the -dev pkg always helps.
sorry... liblame0 and liblame-dev are the packages i have installed
could you email me a copy of your .so file, just so i could try it?
sure... /msg me the address.
